trial_identification.studytitle: Heart function in women with preeclampsia after treatment
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Cardiac function in women with preeclampsia after treatment interventions

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Fetal medicine and complications of pregnancy

interventions.interventions: Observations of cardiac function using transthoracic echocardiography at the time of treatment interventions. Transthoracic echocardiography will be performed prior to and after treatment interventions and also after the intervention of passive leg raising to assess stroke volume changes. Transthoracic echocardiography will also be performed in healthy pregnant women at rest and during passive leg raising. Transthoracic echocardiography examination will take approximately 15 minutes. The post-intervention measurements will occur within 60 minutes of the drug being administered.
interventions.comparator: Observations of cardiac function using transthoracic echocardiography in gestationally matched healthy pregnant women

primaryOutcome.outcome: systolic function assessed by transthoracic echocardiography
primaryOutcome.timepoint: at the time of diagnosis of preeclampsia, within 60 minutes of treatment interventions

primaryOutcome.outcome: diastolic function assessed by transthoracic echocardiography
primaryOutcome.timepoint: at the time of diagnosis of preeclampsia, within 60 minutes of treatment interventions

secondaryOutcome.outcome: cardiac complications - acute pulmonary oedema, arrhythmia, sustained hypertension after treatment, hypotension requiring treatment
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: during hospital stay - post birth data obtained from medical record

secondaryOutcome.outcome: neurological complications - seizure, blindness, intracerebral haemorrhage or infarction
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: during hospital stay - post birth data obtained from medical record
during hospital stay - post birth data obtained from medical record

secondaryOutcome.outcome: gastrointestinal complications - hepatic rupture, signficantly elevated liver enzymes
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: during hospital stay - post birth data obtained from medical record
during hospital stay - post birth data obtained from medical record
during hospital stay - post birth data obtained from medical record
during hospital stay - post birth data obtained from medical record
during hospital stay - post birth data obtained from medical record

eligibility.inclusivecriteria:
Women with preeclampsia - non-labouring women, non-smokers, no vasoactive treatments or intravenous fluids adninstered, no previous cardiac disease or uterine abnormality.
Healthy pregnant women - non-labouring women, no significant medical or surgical illness, non smokers, no uterine abnormalities and normally defined placentation. They will not be receiving any vasoactive medication including salbutamol or thyroid replacement hormones.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: labouring women, current administration of vasoactive drugs including salbutamol and thyroxine, pre-existing or gestational diabetes, smoking, and a known uterine abnormality.

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: Corner Flemington Road and Grattan Street, Parkville, Victoria, 3052, Australia

fundingsource.fundingaddress: Suite 603 Eastpoint Tower, 180 Ocean Steet, Edgecliffe, 2027, NSW

secondarysponsor.sponsoraddress: The Department of Pharmacology Level 8, Medical Building (No. 181) Corner of Grattan Street and Royal Parade University of Melbourne Victoria 3010 Australia

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The purpose of this study is to determine heart function in pregnant women after they are treated for the disease of preeclampsia. The reason to do this is that the drug treatments that are used to control the high blood pressure in this disease have not been examined with respect to how they alter heart function in these sick pregnant women.
